definition[0]: (1901â€“66) a US film producer who started his own company in the 1920s, and is famous especially for making cartoon films for children, and for inventing some of the best-known cartoon characters, including Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck. His cartoon films include Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs and Fantasia, and he also made many nature films and adventure films for children. His company continues to make popular films, especially for children.
